mn141:21.1_0: And what is the noble truth of the origin of suffering?
mn141:21.2_0: the craving that leads to rebirth, that comes with delight and sensual desire, ever delighting in this and that,

mn141:21.4_0: This is called the noble truth of the origin of suffering.
mn141:22.1_0: And what is the noble truth of the cessation of suffering?
mn141:22.2_0: It’s the fading away and cessation of that very same craving with nothing left over; giving it away, letting it go, releasing it, and not adhering to it.
mn141:22.3_0: This is called the noble truth of the cessation of suffering.
